Extra0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Oooh, a <clr:0000>special edition<clr:ffff>! I hope it's more
exciting news, like "Zelda Returns Safely!"
or something.
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>"Demon King, Cause of the Upheaval,
Returns!" <sp:5:1:0>That...that isn't good news,
I don't think.
"Sources have confirmed the <clr:0000>return of the
Demon King<clr:ffff> within Hyrule Castle. Watch
out for increased monster activity."
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Good things aren't called "<clr:0000>demon kings<clr:ffff>"!
I don't think I want to go outside after
reading all that...
Extra0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>A <clr:0000>special edition<clr:ffff>, huh? I hope it isn't
anything bad...

<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Notice>"Princess Zelda Sighted!"<sp:5:1:0> What?!


"While observing Hyrule Castle via her
telescope, renowned scientist Purah
reportedly spotted Princess Zelda."
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Wow! If this is true, then that's a huge
breakthrough, isn't it?
Talk2000:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Let's see...<sp:5:1:0> What's in this issue of the
Lucky Clover Gazette...
Extra0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"While observing Hyrule Castle via her
telescope, renowned scientist Dr. Purah
reportedly spotted Princess Zelda."
That huge thing in <clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff> is the
telescope they're talking about, isn't it?

I see why they put out a special edition...
Talk2001:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>There's so much to read in these
newspapers!
Talk1031:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>"Sand Shroud Skidoos, Gerudo Rejoice."
Skidoos? <sp:5:1:0>Oh! It's gone. <sp:5:0:0>I get it now.<sp:0:4:0>"Gerudo Desert has returned to normal!
Around the same time the Gerudo chief,
Riju, wiped out the terrifying monsters...
"the unusual sand shroud that plagued
the area cleared up!" That chief is quite
the leader, I say!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I heard she became chief when she was
quite young. It's really amazing how much
she's accomplished!
Talk2004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What's the Lucky Clover Gazette covering
in this edition?
Talk2005:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I always read every word of these
newspapers...
Talk1101:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"Freezing Temperatures Bring Feathery
Shivers to the Rito.<sp:0:4:0>"<clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff> is facing a food shortage as
cold winds make travel to the village
dangerous for resident and visitor alike!"
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>That's awful! It sounds like anyone trying
to get to Rito Village needs to <clr:0000>prepare
themselves for harsh, freezing weather<clr:ffff>.
Talk1041:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>"Groundbreaking Gains in Recent
Research Emerge.<sp:0:4:0>"A previously unknown slab has been
discovered at the Ring Ruins. Mr. Tauro
expects Zonai research to leap forward!"
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Hm. I recall that Mr. Tauro was the leader
of the Zonai Survey Team. He'd found a
clue to reading Zonai text...
Quite the impressive undertaking to learn
how to read the words of those from
another era... It's tiring to think about!
Talk2007: <sp:3:0:2:0700>No big new stories today, it seems...
Talk1111:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"Gorons Ravenous for Red Rocks."
<sp:5:1:0>Well, that's interesting...<sp:0:4:0>"There has been an uptick in nefarious
activities by some members of the Goron
tribe. Travelers to <clr:0000>Goron City<clr:ffff>, beware!"
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>This must be some kind of joke! Everyone
knows how kind-hearted Gorons are...
Talk1801:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Heh. You can learn about the world
without even having to travel!

I really love the<clr:0000> Lucky Clover Gazette<clr:ffff>—
though it does seem like they're short-
staffed. I bet I could be a journalist...
Talk1802:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's amazing how much you can learn
about the world just by spending a little
time reading...
All thanks to the<clr:0000> Lucky Clover Gazette<clr:ffff>—
though it does seem like they're short-
staffed. Could I be a journalist? Yeah!
Talk1121:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"City of Water Awash in Pollution."
Whaaat?!<sp:0:4:0>"Filthy water and ominous goop have
swamped <clr:0000>Zora's Domain<clr:ffff>. Reports suggest
medical resources there are at the limit!"
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>That's awful! It definitely sounds like
<clr:0000>Zora's Domain<clr:ffff> is not the place to be for
the average traveler right now...
Talk1501:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Uplifting News. The Skyview Towers
Are Now Active.<sp:0:4:0>"The Skyview Towers, developed by
eminent researcher Purah and built in
every region, now light up our skies!
"The brave swordsman Link was the first
to soar overhead via a tower's launching
platform!"
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>So that's what those huge things are. I'd
heard they were for making maps,<sp:5:1:0> but
what's this about a "launching platform"?
Talk1131:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"Doom Looms in the Gerudo Desert."<sp:5:1:0>
Well, that sounds awful...<sp:0:4:0>"<clr:0000>Unknown monsters<clr:ffff> have been spotted in

tribe in as dire straits as it seems?"
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Monsters are already scary, but unknown
monsters?<sp:5:1:0> That's...that's at least doubly
scary! Count me out!
Talk1503:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"Signs of a New Weapon Fad."
Hm. Interesting...

"With weapons decaying all over the land,
more and more people are embellishing

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Hmph. When the Upheaval occurred,
some of that strange <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff> got on my
brand-new sword and caused it to decay.

Talk3002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! There's an update on the
"Yiganapping of Princess Zelda"
story from earlier...
"Sources now state that the incident at
Dueling Peaks Stable was a Yiga Clan plot
to appear to kidnap the princess."
I had read somewhere that the Yiga Clan
are really good at disguising themselves...

<sp:3:0:2:0200>But a Yiga disguised as the princess, then
pretending they'd been kidnapped? Geez,
they're a really strange bunch!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Oh, but that means the princess is still
missing.

I hope she's OK...
Talk1508:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Blood Moon Brings Dangerous Nights.<sp:0:4:0>"Be wary, dear readers! On nights when a
blood moon rises, so, too, do monsters
that had been defeated!"
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Huh. This reminds me of that researcher
who was studying the blood moon.

They were really excited to visit a monster
fort and examine the relationship between
the monsters and the blood moon.
I hope they're doing OK. <sp:5:0:0>I don't know if
they'd be able to hold their own in a fight.
Talk3003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! There's an update on the "White

heard goats weren't picky eaters...
Talk1509:

Talk3010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! There's an update on the "Nearly

But what was the misunderstanding?!

Talk1152:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>So the Master Sword really does exist...


It must really be amazing if it's considered
a legendary blade...
Talk3005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! There's an update on the "Royal
Robbery! Is Princess Zelda a Suspect?"
story from earlier...
"Mr. I at <clr:0000>Wetland Stable<clr:ffff> was mistaken!
The tools reported missing were used to
make the best flower bed in Hyrule!"
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Well, there you have it! I knew the original
story had holes in it... There's no way the
princess is a thief!
Talk3011:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! There's an update on the "Disarm or
Die! Ominous Voice of Princess Zelda
Threatens Travelers" story from earlier...
"The voice believed to be Princess Zelda
was a woman practicing her singing!
And rather than 'leave the arms'...
"she was actually singing the words 'seek
the storm'! This reporter is as shocked as
our readers at this mistake."
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>How can they have misheard those words
so badly?

<sp:3:0:2:0701>On reflection, the whole story seems
really unbelievable, but I was eating it
up when I first read it too...
Talk1153:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>To cause something like the Upheaval...
This Demon King must be a really
scary guy.
I hope the Goddess Hylia protects Link...
Talk3006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! There's an update on the "Horror in
Hyrule. Unknown Terror Lurks" story
from earlier...
"The previously unknown monster has
now been confirmed to be a Dondon,
a species discovered by Princess Zelda!"
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Oh, that's amazing! And I didn't even
know that Princess Zelda was an animal
expert. She sure does a lot...
Talk3012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! An update on the "Princess Zelda
Cuts Off Current" story from earlier...

"Investigations revealed that the well was
home to both water and monsters—the
princess was helping the stable after all!"
<sp:3:0:2:0800>So Princess Zelda forbid use of the well
in order to protect the stable from the
monsters below!
Oh, it seems so obvious now! I'm glad
someone looked into things.

I don't think my heart could take the
idea of Princess Zelda doing something
to hurt innocent people.
Talk3007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Oh! There's an update on the "Mysterious

Stable" story from earlier...
"The mysterious, aid-seeking woman was
actually a member of the Yiga Clan
attempting to trap the swordsman Link."
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS>The more I read about the Yiga Clan, the
dumber they seem. Do any of their plans
ever work out?
And of all people, did they really think
they could trick someone like Princess
Zelda's faithful swordsman, Link?
Talk3013:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>What's this? It's not an article...<sp:0:4:0>"Princess Zelda, We Will Never Give Up."<sp:0:4:0>Ah, I see. It's a kind of declaration!<sp:0:4:0>"The Lucky Clover Gazette has diligently

You know, it sounds like being a reporter
is a pretty cool job. I wonder if the Lucky
Clover Gazette is hiring new reporters...

Talk3021:

I'm shaking just reading the headline!
What's the story...
"Lucky Clover Gazette dispatches top

<sp:3:0:2:0a00>New Serenne Stable, huh? I think that's

I know it's just a rumor, but as soon as I

Talk3025:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Nearly Naked Research Leaves

<sp:3:0:2:0700>Hmm, what's this one... "Matriarch

Talk3026:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Disarm or Die! Ominous Voice of

What?! There's no way that's true! What's

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Highland Stable, huh? That's far to the

Talk3032:

fashion. I should really visit some day...
Talk3027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Princess Zelda Cuts Off Current."<sp:0:4:0>She did what?! <sp:5:0:0>Why would she do such
a thing?!

<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Pirates Strike at Pristine Ocean Resort."<sp:0:4:0>Woof, pirates... And an ocean resort?

following a formidable pirate attack.

this article, but I guess it makes sense

Talk3029:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>"White Goats Go Amiss." Oh no! Those

<sp:3:0:2:0700>"Plunderous Pirates Pushed Out to Sea.
